title: LoL is not able to install on MAC
body:
As the title states, when I click on the LoL install button, nothing happens or downloads. I am using chrome by the way. Why am i installing the game in the first place you ask? 

So, the last pvp match i played. (Before i chose to re-install) the game kept on freezing. I could move my cursor though. I chose to exit ( cmmd + alt + esc) and reconnect. Every time i reconnected, it would freeze after a couple of seconds. I could not type as well. This happened around 4 times before i chose to exit LoL and log back in, because it usually works. However, i could not log back in or get on. 

Whenever I clicked on LoL, only the logo would show up and nothing will happen. After a few minutes, this message will pop up. (Sorry for the arrows and stuff) 
http://i.imgur.com/qr3U60z.png

This happened for a day, every time i wanted to go on, it would not let me. So I deleted LoL so I can re-install. I tried the remove solutions fix and the remove some files ( I forgot what it was) but none of that seemed to do anything. I went on the LoL site and clicked on play now. Then I chose the option already have an account lalala. Every time i clicked on the download button, nothing will happen and after a few moments this screen would come up.
http://i.imgur.com/MFOSzsR.png

This has happened everytime for the past day. Just recently, i have cleared my browsing data just incase that was the case but it would still not let me download.

Please help and thank you!

replies.body: Could you please provide the logs that it generated this would help me solve your issue.
Hi, thank you for you reply but I do not know how to get the logs.

Applications/League of Legends/Contents/LOL/RADS

In this folder you'll find the patcher logs. You may need to right-click and select "Show contents" at some point, like when you get to "League of Legends".
Hi! Thank you but sadly I have deleted LoL. The problem now it that I am unable to install it. Sorry for the confusion.

Oh.

Well, that's bothersome. I can confirm that other people are also experiencing this. Try downloading League using a browser other than Chrome.

The only other browser I have on mac is Safari. Still it would not work. 

I clicked on play now, and selected the option. Already have an account ......  I have attached the screen shot.

After I clicked on the button, it started loading but stopped. As shown in the screenshot. It has not moved for 10 minutes.

Oh, that was Safari? What's with programs all trying to look like one-another these days?

But hey, that's *not* the error others are getting. They were getting a page along the lines of "The address is wrong or this page doesn't exist". This might be solvable.

I know you said you've uninstalled, but I'd like you to try somethings, if you will. [Change your DNS](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq4) and [turn off your firewall](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#wq2), then try again. Tell me what happens.

Sorry but the links do not work

http://i.imgur.com/SKgIUoh.png

http://i.imgur.com/5qUxIG3.png

Oh dear, that means you've lost access to the support page. I can access them perfectly fine.

I presume if you bring up your terminal and ping riotgames.com, you'd return nothing.

I'll say the copy and paste the instructions from there. To change your DNS to Google's Public DNS:

        Open System Preferences
        Open the Network preference pane
        Select the active connection on the left, and click the "Advanced..." button in the lower right hand corner
        Click "DNS" from the selection bar.
        Remove any current DNS entries, and input the following public DNS servers:
       >8.8.8.8
8.8.4.4
    
Save your changes by selecting "OK"
    Apply the changes by clicking "Apply" in the lower right hand corner

Unfortunately firewalls are each unique, meaning you'll have to go through their help page in order to do it.
Thank you so much! I just changed my DNS and it worked. Thank you so so so much!!!

Awesome. Just keep in mind that you're using Google's Public DNS, not your ISP's default, meaning features like data-metering and access to their page without using credit will not work.

Try switching back to your default every once in a while, just to see if the problem's fixed.
I got the same problem bro.
